dt: {bc}a relative whose kinship is traceable exclusively through males

et: borrowed from Latin {it}agnātus{/it} "younger child, male blood relative on the father's side," noun from {it}agnātus,{/it} past participle of {it}agnāscī{/it} "to be born in addition (to), grow later," from {it}ad-{/it} {et_link|ad-|ad-} + {it}gnāscī, nāscī{/it} "to be born" {ma}{mat|nation|}{/ma}
shortdef: a relative whose kinship is traceable exclusively through males

dt: {bc}related through male descent or on the father's side

shortdef: related through male descent or on the father's side
